root.TEXT:
Record date: 2081-10-02
Spanish 69 Sheffield Road NOONAN, FRANCE Burkburnett, NE 97618 51639357 (842) 544-2703 10/02/81
CHIEF COMPLAINT: Mr. Noonan is a 69-year-old man who has type II insulin-requiring diabetes, obesity, hypertension, dyslipidemia, chronic atrial fibrillation, degenerative osteoarthritis and diabetic neuropathy.
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: He comes today complaining of one week with mild chest pain not irradiated to the head, to jaw or the arm, but with very mild shortness of breath. He denies nausea, vomiting or sweatiness.
CURRENT MEDICATIONS: Protonix 40 mg p.o. b.i.d., verapamil SR 190 mg q.d., Lasix 20 mg p.o. q.d., Neurontin 900 mg in the morning 900 mg at noon and 300 mg at night, Lipitor 10 mg q.d., Zestril 10 mg q.d., Glucophage 1000 mg twice a day, and 75/25 insulin 40 units in the morning and 40 in the evening, Tylenol with Codeine p.r.n. for severe pain and Coumadin 3 mg alternating with 4.5 mg.
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION: The blood pressure today is 120/88 and his weight is 256 pounds. The examination of the neck with no lymph nodes. He is oriented and in no acute distress. The cardiac examination with arrhythmia consistent with atrial fibrillation. The lungs with hypoventilation in both bases and no evidence of acute congestive heart failure. He has edema that has been chronic in both extremities.
ASSESSMENT AND PLAN: Review of an EKG obtained in August of this year showed atrial fibrillation with premature ventricular or apparently conducted complexes, nonspecific T-wave abnormality probably digitalis effect, abnormal EKG that when compared to the one in June showed nonspecific T-wave abnormalities that were not evident at that time and now present in anterior leads.
I have talked to people in the emergency department and he is being sent right now for an evaluation of possible angina.
______________________________ DANNY WOODY, M.D.
